content.question: Students are collecting data as they control the toy helicopter shown. The helicopter has a mass <math alttext="meter"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and must exert a thrust of power <math alttext="P sub 0"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to initially move upward with a constant speed <math alttext="v sub 0"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> . The students then cause the helicopter to exert a thrust so that a net force <math alttext="F sub net equals 2 m g"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> accelerates it upward. As the helicopter is accelerating, it has a thruster power <math alttext="P sub f"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , and as it passes a height <math alttext="h sub 0"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> it has a speed of <math alttext="3 v sub 0"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The ratio <math alttext="the fraction P sub f over P sub 0"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is most nearly

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
